abstract: The upheaval in the mortgage market, a slowing economy and an increasingly stretched consumer have made the last few quarters among the toughest since Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman and chief executive of Bank of America, took over in 2001.
lead_paragraph: The upheaval in the mortgage market, a slowing economy and an increasingly stretched consumer have made the last few quarters among the toughest since Kenneth D. Lewis, the chairman and chief executive of Bank of America, took over in 2001.

headline.main: After Losses, BofA’s Lewis Welcomes Rate Cut
